text: When I notice doubts about long-term partnership, I recognize them and choose to understand what they're telling me.
During moments when commitment feels challenging, I notice my resistance and choose to address it honestly instead of avoiding it.
When I feel the pull to avoid long-term commitment, I notice it and choose to explore what's behind it instead.
I let doubts about partnership prevent me from committing to long-term relationships and maintaining healthy marriage.
When I notice readiness for marriage, I recognize it and choose to build the skills needed for long-term partnership.
I see when I'm struggling with commitment, and I choose to understand and work through the underlying fears.
When I feel the urge to run from long-term partnership, I notice it and choose to face what's causing the fear.
I let not being built for partnership prevent me from identifying and developing readiness for long-term commitment.
When I notice readiness building, I recognize it and choose to prepare myself for the responsibilities of marriage.
I recognize when commitment fears are based on old patterns rather than present reality, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the pull to avoid marriage readiness, I notice it and choose to assess my readiness honestly instead.
I let struggle with commitment prevent me from building the capacity for long-term partnership and healthy marriage.
When I notice patterns that support long-term partnership, I recognize them and choose to strengthen them.
I see when I'm ready for marriage, and I choose to build the emotional and practical foundation needed.
When I feel the urge to avoid assessing my readiness, I notice it and choose to face the question honestly instead.
I let doubts about being built for partnership prevent me from committing to and maintaining long-term relationships.
When I notice readiness for long-term commitment, I recognize it and choose to develop the skills for healthy marriage.
I recognize when commitment struggles come from fear rather than genuine incompatibility, and I choose to work through them.
When I feel the pull to avoid long-term partnership, I notice it and choose to understand and address the underlying issues.
I let not identifying my readiness prevent me from committing to long-term partnership and maintaining healthy marriage.
